poem.author: Peter McCarey
poem.text: The banns are read, the groom brags I got Morka! Platinum bands get swapped He bags the dowry. Bras and pants of listed Brands no longer cover one prosthesis And one dysfunction. Oh well. But sure the little barbs and balms of medicine ...? I see. He bans all mention. Someone blabs. The nation's Bars hear talk of nothing else till the football game. Barns are full of wind. The chaff And bran's been sold with the wheat, as bards proclaim Morka the big stick, Morka The biggest pussy of them all.
